name: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Students will learn the basics of programming languages and basic computer science concepts such as algorithms, data structures, computer hardware, and basic software engineering concepts.

name: Discrete Mathematics
description: Students will learn about mathematical concepts and structures that are fundamental to computer science, including sets, logic, relations, graphs, and basic probability and counting principles.

name: Programming Fundamentals
description: Students will develop their programming skills beyond the introductory level, and will learn how to design, implement, debug, and evaluate small programs using good programming practices.

name: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Students will learn how to design, analyze, and implement algorithms and data structures, including arrays, lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs, and will learn about basic algorithmic analysis techniques.

name: Computer Organization and Architecture
description: Students will learn about the principles of digital logic, computer organization, and computer architecture, including topics such as data representation, computer arithmetic, memory hierarchy, I/O, and CPU design.

name: Operating Systems
description: Students will learn about the principles and design of operating systems, including process management, memory management, device management, file systems, and security.

name: Database Systems
description: Students will learn about the principles of database management systems, including data modeling, database design, relational algebra, SQL, and transactions.

name: Programming Languages
description: Students will learn about the principles and design of programming languages, including syntax, semantics, and type systems, and will learn about language processing techniques such as lexing, parsing, and interpretation.

name: Computer Networks
description: Students will learn about the principles and design of computer networks, including basic network protocols, LANs, WANs, the internet, transport protocols, and network security.

name: Theory of Computation
description: Students will learn about the theoretical foundations of computation, including formal languages, automata, computability, complexity theory, and algorithmic randomness.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: Students will learn about the principles and applications of artificial intelligence, including topics such as search, logic, knowledge representation, uncertainty, machine learning, and natural language processing.

name: Computer Graphics
description: Students will learn about the principles and techniques of computer graphics, including 2D and 3D graphics, geometric modeling, rendering, animation, and human-computer interaction.

name: Software Engineering
description: Students will learn about the principles and practices of software engineering, including project management, requirement engineering, software design, verification and validation, and software maintenance.
